metadata.Title: CVE-2011-3241 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
WebKit, as used in Apple iTunes before 10.5, allows man-in-the-middle attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via vectors related to iTunes Store browsing, a different vulnerability than other CVEs listed in APPLE-SA-2011-10-11-1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-3241` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 22.0
chromium-browser-l10n - 22.0
chromium-chromedriver - 22.0
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 22.0
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 22.0
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> qt4-x11 unmaintained upstream (see README.webkit for details) sbeattie> iTunes Store specific? jdstrand> marking chromium-browser as fixed since it has 22+ on all releases and they sync with upstream webkit every few weeks

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '22.0').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
webkitgtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.9-2ubuntu2').
